citation.article-title: Variovorax ginsengisoli sp. nov., a denitrifying bacterium isolated from soil of a ginseng field
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Variovorax ginsengisoli sp. nov.
Variovorax ginsengisoli (gin.sen.gi.so′li. N.L. n. ginsengum ginseng; L. n. solum soil; N.L. gen. n. ginsengisoli of soil of a ginseng field, the source of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic or facultatively anaerobic, motile and rod-shaped, 0.3–0.5 μm in diameter and 1.5–3.0 μm long after 3 days of culture on R2A agar.
Colonies grown on R2A agar (Difco) for 3 days are undulatory, convex, embedded, yellowish and 2–5 mm in diameter.
Grows well at 4–30 °C and at pH 5.0–8.5, but does not grow at 37 °C.
Growth occurs in the absence of NaCl and in the presence of 1.0 % (w/v) NaCl, but not in the presence of 2 % (w/v) NaCl.
Nitrate is reduced aerobically and is reduced to nitrogen under anaerobic conditions.
Anaerobic growth does not occur in the absence of nitrate.
Unable to degrade DNA, chitin, cellulose, skimmed milk, olive oil or xylan.

Utilizes acetate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, valerate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, propionate, lactate, suberate, alanine, histidine, proline and malonate as sole carbon sources, but not itaconate, malate, d-fucose, d-fructose, l-rhamnose, l-sorbose, d-ribose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, maleic acid, salicin, serine or inositol.
Other substrate utilization, enzyme production and physiological characteristics are given in Table 1.

Susceptible to penicillin G (20 U), erythromycin (25 μg), streptomycin (50 μg), chloramphenicol (100 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), neomycin (30 μg), and oleandomycin (15 μg) but resistant to ampicillin (20 μg), novobiocin (5 μg), gentamicin (30 μg) and lincomycin (15 μg).
The predominant ubiquinone is Q-8 and C16 : 0 and C17 : 0 cyclo are the major cellular fatty acids.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 66.0 mol% (determined by HPLC).
The type strain, Gsoil 3165T (=KCTC 12583T =LMG 23392T), was isolated from soil of a ginseng field of Pocheon Province, South Korea.
